intro: Schizoglossum biflorum var. integrum, commonly known as the smooth-flowered schizoglossum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic study.
